attributes.action: Reopen Parliament before reopening schools. MPs should be guinea pigs, not kids.
attributes.background: The Govt intends to reopen Schools subsequent to the Covid-19 lockdown. Children should not be allowed back into an untested environment until scientific and medical advice and testing supports this. Parliament should reopen before any school and MPs must be on a three line whip to attend.
attributes.additional_details: Quite simply the Government should not put children back into an untested environment and should lead by example and reconvene Parliament. This will enable the populace to see that MPs are representing their electorate and are confident in the scientific and medical advice being given on easing lockdown by Boris Johnson and the Government. Any MP, that does not attend Parliament should have to give a full explanation, to both the House of Commons and to their constituency electorate.

attributes.action: Allow Garden Centres to re-open, with social distancing measures.
attributes.background: Garden centres generally have a large retail area for customers to shop in, with a large amount of this area outside. This makes it easier than most other retail businesses to socially distance from others, easier than many supermarkets certainly. Spring is the busiest time of year for the industry.
attributes.additional_details: Although classed as non-essentilal, gardening is considered by many, government included, as good for physical and mental health generally, but especially during this lockdown period - See 'Guidance for the public on mental health and wellbeing aspects of coronavirus (COVID-19)'. Enabling people to access plants and other materials to partake in this activity in a safe environment with social distancing, would be good for them and also the business and the industry at this usually very busy time.

attributes.action: Make the release of lanterns illegal under the Environmental protection act 1990
attributes.background: Issue fixed penalty notices for littering under section 87 of the environmental protection act 1990 (preventing persons from depositing litter into environment) to anybody who is found to be releasing open flame lanterns or found in possession of such lanterns.
attributes.additional_details:
These lanterns are creating massive invisible implications to the environment we call home. We need to take measures to prevent the solid matter pollution throughout our earths habitats. And this can start very simply by banning the sale or fining the users of open flame lanterns that cause multiple livestock, pet and wildlife fatalities and injuries every year. 
They are pointless, gain nothing and potentially damage a lot, so remove them from circulation and punish anybody found using them.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: Ban the use of "Night lanterns" and "Fire lanterns" "Chinese Lanterns"
attributes.background: Ban the use of paper and fabric "night sky lanterns" "fire lanterns" "Chinese lanterns" and other floating fire lights due to the evidence and extremely high risks of fire and destruction to property, persons, livestock, and danger to wildlife caused by their use.
attributes.additional_details:
Sky lanterns are a huge danger to wildlife, public homes farmland and property. Although the release of them are banned on Council owned land and property in *Wales* it's still entirely legal to release paper lanterns in England !!!!!
Over 200,000 sky lanterns are sold and released each year in the UK. Sky lanterns cause injury and suffering to animals and marine life, and livestock and have a devastating impact on the environment and residences and cause an avoidable use of fire services.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: Remove 5G Mobile Phone Towers
attributes.background: scientific evidence is required to prove they present 'zero danger' from electromagnetic energy and create a zero risk to the occupational health of persons, the built environment including conservation habitat and wildlife
attributes.additional_details: Debate the risks to public health and release all manufacturing data pertaining to the 'risk assessment studies' of 5G mobile phone towers

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Reintroduce Sunday Closing
attributes.background: Once the current Coronavirus Pandemic is managed, create legislation prohibiting the opening of businesses excluding those in the catering, hospitality and seasonal industries.
attributes.additional_details:
The current lockdown in the UK has had a noted positive impact upon communities, families and the environment. 

Communities are engaging and working together, once the pandemic is over it would be saddening to return to "normal". Sunday closing would allow people time, without commercial distractions, to engage with their communities, families and friends. Environmentally it would also allow our environment a much-needed breath of air and impact upon our climate targets

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310336

attributes.action: Please turn off unnecessary lights in towns and cities during the lockdown.
attributes.background: As the UK is under lockdown, looking at the traffic cams, towns and cities are deserted but they are all brighter than a Christmas tree. Imagine what two to three weeks of at least half of these lights off would do for the environment and for the electric bills.
attributes.additional_details:
London's West End is one of the biggest culprits with all lights outside all shops, theatres and buildings still on. Do we really need them? Shops don't need flashing signage lights on right now, the screens in Picadilly Circus, Pier lights in seaside towns, do these all need to be on.
If we must all be mandated to stay in our homes at the threat of a fine or arrest, can attention also be paid to our carbon footprint and have all unnecessary lights turned off.

attributes.action: Stop the UK Prime Minister from posting 30 Million letters.
attributes.background: UK Prime Minister intends to write to every UK household; 30 Million letters urging people to stay at home and save the NHS. This campaign will cost the tax payers £6 Million and use approximately 100 million papers (letter and envelope), damage to environment and expose postmen to the virus.
attributes.additional_details: Fighting against Coronavirus requires a coordinated approach. Instead of wasting papers, public money and exposing postal service staff to coronavirus, UK Government should use digital platforms like YouTube, Google, Facebook, WhatsApp, TV channels and other social media outlets to launch a digital campaign urging people to stay at home and save lives. A digital campaign can be used multiple times to reinforce the message.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Employees who work in a care home should be considered skilled and professionals
attributes.background: Employees who work in care homes (especially care assistants) should be titled as skilled professionals just like NHS employees. They should also get increased wages for the work they do. Additionally, they should be required for more training.
attributes.additional_details: Personally working as a care assistant in an elderly care home, it takes an incredible amount of training, responsibility and a constant positive mindset to work in these environments. Most of these skills cannot be taught. It can be physically and mentally draining for an employee in a care home; they have people's lives in their hands just as much as NHS employees do. They seem to be forgotten about. Where is our recognition for the work we do? Where is our respect?

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for designating workers as skilled, except in reference to certain immigration matters, and is also not responsible for the pay of privately employed workers.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to consider social care as equally important to NHS, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302897

attributes.action: Universities should cancel all assignments and deadlines during COVID19
attributes.background: The government should cancel all assignment and deadlines as students are unable to concentrate due to the panic of the Coronavirus. Universities have been shut which means less face to face contact, resources and libraries. Students have not received the full teaching experience for semester 2
attributes.additional_details: This should be done as students who cannot work from home due to dysfunctional families, lack of resources such as laptops and due to people being out of work how can they sustain bills and themselves during this pandemic. Students are now stressed and do not have proper guidance and help with these assignments and are forced to carry on regardless of what is going on globally. Online classes are not enough. Majority of students work better in the university environment and not at home. Grades will be affected. Something needs to be done ASAP

rejection.details:
Decisions about university teaching, assessments and exams are a matter for individual universities, and decisions about university admissions are a matter for individual universities and UCAS, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you have concerns about admissions you should raise these with UCAS, and if you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.

We understand that the current situation is stressful for many people, including students. Student Minds, a mental health charity for students, is collating guidance and developing resources to support students experiencing stress as a result of the current situation, which you may find useful: https://www.studentminds.org.uk/coronavirus.html

attributes.action: Close all non-essential construction sites
attributes.background:
Numerous non-essential construction sites are still open as companies put profits before people. 

It is impossible to properly social distance in this environment, and these companies have shown they will not put safety first unless forced

Please protect our construction workers
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that these sites should be closed down, there is no need for non-essential building sites to remain open. These construction workers cannot properly social distance when working, and they are having to board overcrowded public transport as providers reduce services. 

They are being put at risk of contracting and spreading COVID 19 for no reason

attributes.additional_details: International students have had to completely abandon their life and go back to their home countries to be with family. This is not the time to have to worry about an assignment deadline, dissertation or exam revision.

attributes.action: Provide grades without exams and assignments for university students- COVID-19

attributes.additional_details:

attributes.action: Repatriate the British nationals stranded in India
attributes.background: We want you to safely return British nationals to the UK from India amidst the Covid 19 pandemic.
attributes.additional_details:

Hotels/hostels do not want to accept bookings from foreigners, people are being forced out of accommodation. There are British people who are elderly, on life supporting medication, people who are alone in an increasingly hostile environment, we all want to get home and cannot due to restrictions.
We understand we need to comply with local government procedures but we cannot do this and remain safe.

attributes.action: Provide the necessary PPE for those working in a healthcare environment.
attributes.background: Countless medical professionals and hospital staff are without adequate PPE, endangering their lives. The Govt must put pressure on Trusts to allow PPE to be worn per NHS and WHO guidelines for ALL staff (including porters etc). The Govt must also provide funding, allowing the Trusts to provide PPE.
attributes.additional_details: Earlier this week a 36 year old nurse was admitted to ITU due to a COVID19 infection. She is otherwise healthy. Nearly 5000 medics in Italy are being treated for COVID19. PPE, including but not limited to N95 masks, nitrile gloves, gowns and eye masks are all helpful in reducing the viral load to which hospital workers are exposed to. A lower viral load gives the immune system a better chance to fight off the virus meaning less of the NHS frontline are at risk of harmful symptoms of COVID19.

attributes.action: The government to employ black cab drivers to safely ferry NHS staff to work.

attributes.background: Colleges want us to work at home, handing in work as if we were still being tutored in the college environment whilst being taught online instead which is less effective, giving predicted grades would ease the stress of students who may not have the necessary resources or capability as others.
attributes.additional_details: The fact we have to work at home would not create equal or fair educating opportunities for students at home, who may lack the necessary resources compared to others.

attributes.additional_details: The Government needs to understand that although Year 12 students do not have to sit exams next year, they are majorly affected by schools closing down. attributes.action: Create a symptom reporting site, where people with Covid-19 symptoms self-report
attributes.background: Create a self reporting page or app on either the NHS website or the gov.uk website where people experiencing Covid-19 symptoms can self-report to enable the collection of 'actual' numbers, rather than confirmed cases. This will help to track the progression of the disease
attributes.additional_details: As a scientist, I believe we should be taking a more controlled stance on the disease, rather than reacting. However, I recognise that we do not have the people or the tests to test everyone. Collecting this data would enable scientists to track the progression of the disease in the UK and also to have the personal information required to send out self-testing kits once they are available in an environment where people will feel safe to provide personal medical information.

attributes.action: Support vulnerable migrants during the Covid-19 crisis
attributes.background: Immediate action is required by the government and local authorities to safeguard and protect the health and wellbeing of all migrants, particularly those with No Recourse to Public Funds (NRPF) and those experiencing or at risk of homelessness, during the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking councils to ensure that ALL migrants in their area can access the care, support and shelter they need during this crisis, regardless of immigration status and without fear of the consequences. And that means they should also be advocating to central government to end all ‘hostile environment’ policies and suspend immigration-based eligibility criteria for housing assistance and welfare benefits.
Go to:

PPE such as surgical masks, aprons and gloves is not enough! We need more protective PPE. This includes: FFP3 masks, visors, elbow length gloves, surgical gowns.
attributes.additional_details: NHS healthcare workers are not provided with apropriate PPE. We need to work in a safe environment that doesn't put us or the public at risk. NHS workers will get ill and NHS will pay with lives and money. Therefore, we need use the most effective PPE that we currently have, not what is second best.

attributes.background: Scrap the HS2 works and spend the money on buying or manufacturing new ventilators as soon as possible to support the NHS through the Coronavirus outbreak.
attributes.additional_details:
We need trees to breath...

At least 140 years till this project is carbon neutral and we are in the midst of a climate crisis.

HS2 is a waste of our resources right now.

 At the peak of the outbreak the UK will see 60,000-100,000 new patients a week in desperate need of care.

You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300403

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public

attributes.action: Create safe dog leash laws in the UK
attributes.background:
Dog leash laws need to have a place within the UK. We need to create safe, considerate and respectful environments for our dogs and owners. 
To reduce to attacks, unsafe interactions, stressful and triggering scenarios for our dogs. Those in training, reactive, rescued and puppy’s deserve this.
attributes.additional_details:
I got attacked by two off leash dogs whilst walking with my muzzled, leashed and on harness dog. Whilst their owner showed complete disregard and no efforts to help. I shared the story with our online following only to receive an overwhelming amount of responses sharing the same experiences. 
Off leash dogs should not be allowed to approach on leash dogs - in any area.
Owners should respect another owners request to keep dogs away and leash them.  
Introduce muzzle requirements where applicable.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the risks of dogs not being on the lead, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Require dogs to be kept on a lead at all times when in public: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599677

If you want the Government to do something different to the above petition you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: UK Environmental Protection Act
attributes.background: Create & implement a UK wide environmental protection act. To preserve, restore and protect the UK and worldwide climate. Implementing rules, guidelines and sanctions for all businesses, general public, government and public services. To protect the health of individuals and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: To guide and build the public and businesses into a sustainable economy that protects and preserves the environment. It is the only way to ensure true sustainability. To make the move needed to reduce global warming and dangerous climate change that will have detrimental effects on economies, migration, crops, wildlife, disease, and many more factors. Human driven climate change is the biggest danger to our lives in the near future and change needs to happen. The UK should lead the way.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the environment, but we're not sure exactly what new laws you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

An Environment Bill, to make provision about targets, plans and policies for improving the natural environment; for statements and reports about environmental protection; for the Office for Environmental Protection; about waste and resource efficiency; about air quality; for the recall of products that fail to meet environmental standards; about water; about nature and biodiversity; for conservation covenants; about the regulation of chemicals; and for connected purposes, is already being considered by Parliament. You can find out more about this Bill here: https://bills.parliament.uk/bills/2593

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Introduce a Covid safety rating inspection for all public places
attributes.background: Based on the Food Standards Agency 'Scores on the Doors' rating system, public places such as shops, restaurants, supermarkets etc should periodically be inspected to check their Covid 19 safety standard. The rating would allow the public to assess the health risk before entering the premises.
attributes.additional_details: We are now aware the Country will have to live with the Covid 19 virus for a long while; to introduce an amendment within the Health and Safety act allowing Local Authorities to assess public places for their Covid safety and to then to award a rating next to their inspection. This will give the public a better understanding on how safe the establishment they are visiting is. The rating should create a safer environment, keeping business owners in check of the need to protect their customers welfare.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Other gender identity bathrooms to be mandatory in schools.
attributes.background: i would like to see non gendered bathrooms in schools.
attributes.additional_details: There are many people who do not identify as male or female, and when it comes to going to the bathroom, they don’t know where to go. i think we should introduce other gender bathrooms, to make people feel more included and comfortable within their schooling environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562514

attributes.action: I would like you to stop exporting plastic waste from the UK to poorer countries
attributes.background: The UK currently is the second largest exporter of plastic to poorer countries. The EU have banned export of plastic from 1 January 2021, however we have not. The plastic that we export often ends up in the ocean polluting the ecosystems of our planet, or it is burnt or ends up as land fill waste.
attributes.additional_details: We need to be leading the way on environmental issues such as this. It is not okay for the UK to be exporting plastic. We should be actively looking into sustainable alternatives to plastic use in the UK and also stepping up our own recycling abilities. It is also not okay that we are asking poorer countries to take our waste, for then it to pollute the environment in so many harmful ways. This is a global concern, that we have the utmost responsibility for.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331061

attributes.action: Cancel all university exams and lower grade boundaries for assessments.
attributes.background: Covid-19 has affected all students yet we have not received the necessary support by the government/ individual universities. Although some support has been put in place, this is not enough for the millions of students who are forced to work in toxic environments. Immediate action must take place.
attributes.additional_details: We advice parliament to acknowledge the effect of the on going lockdown on students mental health and overall well-being. The work produced by students will be severely affected and this must be recognised. Some students in our universities will go on to become key workers and we must show them they are risking their lives for a government who is able to take action for the well-being of theirs.

rejection.details:
Decisions about university teaching, assessments and exams are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.

We understand that the current situation is stressful for many people, including students. Student Minds, a mental health charity for students, is collating guidance and developing resources to support students experiencing stress as a result of the current situation, which you may find useful: https://www.studentminds.org.uk/coronavirus.html

attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks to the public
attributes.background: I would like parliament to consider the banning of fireworks to the general public. I believe only council organised displays should have access to fireworks.
attributes.additional_details: Back garden displays are selfish and inconsiderate. Many people dread bonfire night approaching every year. The affects to some animals are fatal. Fireworks also have a negative impact on the environment and the wildlife. There is evidence of them causing upset to the elderly, newborns, vulnerable people and people suffering from dementia, as well as household pets. I don’t believe that the sale of such items should be for sale and so easily accessible to the public.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

attributes.action: Give parents a choice to send children back to school or continue home schooling
attributes.background: Give parents a choice. Allow parents to continue home schooling their children if they wish, with full online support from the school and without the risk of facing fines and potential legal action being taken against them.
attributes.additional_details:
Some children performed just as well if not better during lockdown outsideof the school setting. Other children have performed poorly and need the school environment.
Parents should be able to decide if their child returns to school without facing punishment.
Schools should support children wish to learn at home by providing the online platforms they did throughout lockdown.
This in turn would aid the ability to social distance in schools as it would mean less pupils attending

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

No prosecution for parents that remove child from school during a pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300399

Require schools to support home learning during Covid-19 outbreak: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334065

attributes.action: Ban the sale of disposable barbeques
attributes.background: The government should ban the sale and use of disposable barbeques. They are a huge risk to nature and the environment, and are very rarely used responsibly. The local councils do not provide adequate disposal areas for these barbeques. This creates a huge risk to the surroundings when left.
attributes.additional_details: There have recently been some disastrous effects from the poor disposal of these barbeques (see the recent Wareham Forest fire, fires in the New Forest, etc.). This has caused irreparable damage to the environment and nature. There have also been a huge amount of emergency service resources used needlessly due to the irresponsible users of these barbeques. These resources would be better spent on those who actually need it.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Make balloon release illegal
attributes.background: I would like to ban the release of balloons into the sky and the environment as it only ever comes to harm to our animals and eco system.
attributes.additional_details: Ingesting balloons can cause death by blocking the digestive and/or respiratory tracts. This has been witnessed and documented in marine and farm animals. Balloons don't decompose quickly, and their strings usually aren't made of biodegradable material, either. All released balloons, including those falsely marketed as “biodegradable latex,” return to Earth. They kill animals and cause power outages. Balloons can travel miles and pollute remote and pristine places.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign this petition calling for the same thing: 

Make releasing helium balloons and sky lanterns a specific littering offence
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609032

attributes.action: Require people to work from home if they can
attributes.background: Require remote working when it's possible, if someone still needs to work in a specific location require that their employer provide appropriate justification as well as offer relocation assistance so that the employee can live within easy walking or cycling distance of their workplace.
attributes.additional_details: As Covid proved, a lot of journeys are unnecessary and many people can work remotely which had a massive impact on fuel demand and emissions. Reducing the need for travel will provide significant benefits to people especially with the current record high fuel prices. Reducing unnecessary travel also benefits the environment and reduces congestion for those who still need to travel.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Provide financial support for schools to install air conditioning in classrooms
attributes.background: Due to climate change, extreme weather events are occurring with increasing frequency. It is unreasonable to expect staff and students to work in classrooms which were not designed to withstand 35-40 degree temperatures, and school budgets are too overstretched to afford effective solutions.
attributes.additional_details: The government should be doing whatever possible to facilitate schools being climate resilient going into the future. Children have already missed enough learning due to the pandemic, they don’t need more missed time due to extreme classroom temperatures putting their health at risk. Closing schools is not a solution as many families are already struggling and may not have suitable cooling facilities at home either. Government must help to make schools safe environments for children.

attributes.action: Mandate standard fuel be ethanol-free & allow lower VAT for fuel with ethanol
attributes.background: The goal of this petition is to mandate that all regular petrol in the UK be ethanol-free and for any alternative fuels with an ethanol content its VAT should be lowered by a percentage up to 20% in accordance with its ethanol content (I.e. E5 = 5% off VAT & E10 = 10% off VAT)
attributes.additional_details:
New research suggests that bioethanol production can contribute to increased levels of CO2, which stem from the farming of the crops used for biofuel and it's transportation from where it is produced to where it is used. When the vehicle burns the fuel it can also cause damage to the vehicle thus lowering overall fuel efficiency. Therefore any mitigation of CO2 emissions from using the fuel is cancelled out. 
 
Ignoring this ethanol issue means we could be doing more damage to the environment, The consumer hasn't seen a price reduction despite petrol being diluted and the ethanol means less MPG is achieved.

attributes.action: Resume face-to-face teaching in Higher Education environments for all courses
attributes.background: After 2 terms of discordance and confusion between the Government and HE students on face-to-face teaching, and following the relaxation of Covid restrictions from April 12, we want the government to provide guidance for and allow Universities to offer face-to-face teaching for all courses.
attributes.additional_details: April 12 marks the day that non-essential retail, outdoor hospitality and personal care venues can reopen. We believe that face-to-face teaching should continue following this relaxation. Current university students have been disproportionately affected by these guidelines. From the 12th, we can spend hours shopping indoors, but do not have access to our lecturers, classes and peers in person. Valuable life experiences and learning have been unnecessarily compromised.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582345

Since you started your petition the Government has announced that remaining university students are to return to campus from Step 3 of the roadmap, no earlier than 17 May: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/remaining-university-students-to-return-to-campus-from-step-3-of-the-roadmap-no-earlier-than-17-may

attributes.action: Do not enact “secrecy clause” on environmental decisions
attributes.background: The Environment Bill contains a “secrecy clause” that will prohibit the Office for Environmental Protection (OEP) from revealing information and correspondence with public bodies.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should not destroy public transparency on environmental decisions.
